isis.stitle: CAM AIR FOUNDATION BRAKES - BRAKE ADJUSTMENT - HALDEX AUTOMATIC SLACK ADJUSTER

svcproc.title: HALDEX AUTOMATIC SLACK ADJUSTER
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 24for the following procedure, steps 1 through 4.

step1.para: Rotate the control arm away from the adjusting hex towards the air chamber, until it comes to a definite internal stop as illustrated.
Most adjusters will be equipped with an installation indicator. Indicator must fall within the slot for proper installation.

para.emph: If the control position is wrong, tight brakes will occur.

step1.para: Tighten all anchor bracket fasteners if loosened or removed. Make sure the control arm does not move while tightening the anchor bracket fasteners.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 25 for steps 5 through 9.

step1.para: The adjuster must be manually adjusted at this time.
Rotate the adjusting hex clockwise until the lining contacts the drum.
Back off the adjuster hex, turning the hex counterclockwise 1/2 turn.
A minimum of 13 ft-lbs. is necessary to overcome the internal clutch. A ratcheting sound will be heard.

Final inspection. With full air pressure, release spring and service brake and check that the installation indicator is within the slotted area. Remove clevis pin and check that the clevis hole and adjuster hole remain in alignment. If the air chamber push rod was pulled into the air chamber, repeat steps 1, 2 and 3. After final inspection, install cotter pin into clevis pin. Refer to Brake Adjustment Stroke Table, for push rod stroke adjustment.
If spring parking brake was serviced, uncage parking brake. Refer to GROUP 04 - AIR BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove floor stands. Road test vehicle for correct brake operation before putting vehicle back into service.
